intro: Isolobus concolor, commonly known as the smoothleaf milkweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and slightly hairy. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink to reddish in color. Isolobus concolor produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, making it unpalatable to most herbivores.
